ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An Appearance_assignment is the identification of the characteristics of visual appearance of geometric or annotation elements. The various visual characteristics that can be assigned to points, curves or surfaces are defined in other application modules.
The appearance can be defined explicitly for each represented element or for a context in which the elements are represented. Several appearance components can be simultaneously specified with an Appearance_assignment.
is the set of instances of entity types listed in appearance_select that characterize the appearance of geometric and annotation objects.

A Context_dependent_appearance_assignment is a type of Appearance_assignment that identifies visual characteristics that apply in the context of a particular viewing context. A view in a drawing sheet or on a screen, a layer are examples of contexts within which particular visual characteristics, such as color or line font, apply.
is the instance of a type selected in appearance_context that identifies the context where the appearance components are valid.

An Over_riding_styled_element is a Styled_element that overrides the visual characteristics of another Styled_element. Over-riding occurs when both instances of Styled_element are included, directly or indirectly, in the same presentation.
An instance of Styled_element may assign a blue color to a circle. An instance of Over_riding_styled_element would override that colour by a red colour.
is the Styled_element whose visual characteristics are over-ridden.

A Styled_element is a type of Representation_item that has presentation information.
Only specializations of Styled_element can be instantiated.
is the Appearance_assignment that specifies the presentation characteristics of the Styled_element.
is a Boolean value that specifies whether the Styled_element is invisible.

A Styled_geometric_model is a type of Styled_model that presents geometric information.
A Styled_geometric_model only specifies the visual characteristics of the presented geometric elements; it does not represent the bi-dimensional projection of the Geometric_model in a view.
is the Geometric_model that contains the presented geometric information.
the context_of_items of the Styled_geometric_model is the context of the styled Geometric_model.
A Styled_model is a type of Representation that contains a set of geometric or annotation elements for which visual characteristics are specified.
is the string that specifies the version identifier of the Styled_model. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
is the set of instances of the types of styled_model_element_select that are included and presented in the Styled_model.
A Styled_model_element is a Styled_element that specifies the visual characteristics of a geometric element.
is the Detailed_geometric_model_element whose visual characteristics are defined.
is the Styled_model that is replicated.
is the Axis_placement that identifies the source of the mapping.
is the Axis_placement or the Cartesian_transformation that identifies the target of the mapping.

A Transformation_based_styled_model is the replication of a Styled_model. The replication transformation is defined by a cartesian transformation.
In the case where the Geometric_coordinate_space of the replicated model is not the same as the Geometric_coordinate_space in which the template_instance is founded, care shall be taken of any difference in the length units of both the instances of Geometric_coordinate_space, as unit conversion may be required.
is the Styled_model that is replicated.
is the cartesian_transformation that is applied, in the replication of the replicated_model, to all its geometric elements.
